userreviews.userReview: Nailbiters is a fascinating journey of an individual (Dora) negotiating a world turned upside down by a powerful alien force. You travel with Dora experiencing the difficulties of navigating and surviving in this new world. The book is impossible to put down as you ponder the fate of Dora. You will be astonished with several twists, turns, and surprises! It’s absolutely worth every second to read as you reflect on Dora’s story and how YOU would handle such situations! And the ending… Enjoy!

Mary K Williams' Nailbiters was indeed a book that kept me on the edge of my seat, wondering what could possibly happen next?Aliens aren't usually my thing, but I appreciated the concept of this thriller. There were a few typos but nothing that distracted from the story. I love how the setup of the book kept our character ambiguous for a little while, but I enjoyed learning more about Dora and her past. The detail (such as the descriptives in the very first gas station raid) was impeccable. I look forward to reading more books by Ms Williams, especially her short story collection. Thank you for sharing your work with us.
An alien story that keeps you in suspense from beginning to end. Very well written with lots of descriptive detail. It's a great read!

Holy smokes this book was amazing!! I can def say that I haven’t read anything like this before. While some books contain a sweet story that makes you smile, other books actually change the way you see the world. Nailbiters changed the way i see the world! Well, i am a Psychology major, so i’ve always questioned the world and the way people behave, but this book gave me so much insight into a very real outcome of humanity, if invaded by Aliens. I think the author did a spectacular job portraying how different personality types would response to such an event. In most invasion stories, the town or country gets thinned out but a group of strong humans work together and eventually emerge as victors against their oppressors. The ugly side of humanity is only shown to the extend of a looted store or maybe one psycho person. Nailbiters goes way into this darkness and shows many ways in which humans could be cruel if they thought they could get away with it in a situation of widespread choas like an invasion. I just loved how human nature was such a big part of the story.The book itself is written kinda in diary form from Dora’s pov and follows her as shes gets into worse and worse situations. She is a strong character but def gets used and abused along the way.The Ending = Mind Blown. It was that good. The book actually comes with a disclaimer saying to stop reading if you don’t want to know the ending. I considered this…but yeah right, i had to know…..and yes, mind blowing. The ending was great and i really feel like i’d like to know more about this world and the aftermath!!Overall, i have to say that i loved this book. I can definitely say that i'd probably make different choices that Dora, but for creativity and storytelling, this was an A++. I would definitely recommend this for older readers who enjoy Alien/Invasion stories. I def wouldn't categorize this as young adult or appropriate for young readers. There are many older themes (rape, murder, graphic violence, etc) introduced in this book, so read with caution if those things bother you. I loved it though, and while i usually stick strictly to YA, i'm really glad i read this book because it really made me think, esp the ending. I am really looking forward to other books by this author.

Nailbiters is a suspense/thriller focused on Dora, a woman who shows remarkable resilience after an alien force dismantles society and threatens the survival of humanity. Williams’ ability to balance the action with Dora’s internal struggle to rationalize this new sinister world adds depth and meaning to the story and makes the reader question what people should be willing to do to survive. If you’re looking for a book that you won’t be able to put down, Nailbiters will keep you engaged and in suspense to the last page!

description: In the wake of a recent invasion, Dora, a scared, strong human is searching for safety as the human population is systematically hunted down and tagged. On a deserted stretch of road her run comes to an end and she is captured and catapulted into a world of vicious bargains and survivalism. Follow her journey from freedom to servitude and addiction and back again as she learns what the alien invaders are after and why no one can stop biting their nails. Nailbiters will engulf you in the early post-apocalyptic world of alien occupation and make you question what it really does mean to be human.
